title: Shipping giant Maersk uses mechanical sails to cut fuel consumption
text:
The world’s largest container shipping company has slashed fuel consumption by 9.2pc by installing mechanical sails on one of its tankers.

Maersk, the Danish shipping giant, found that the sails - which are tall cylindrical structures that spin and propel the tanker along - dramatically decreased fuel use.

The company’s claims were independently verified by experts from Lloyd's Register's Ship Performance Group, a consultancy that specialises in ship efficiency.

First installed on the Maersk Pelican tanker in August 2018, the Norsepower Rotor Sails utilise an aerodynamic phenomenon in which a spinning object travelling through the air generates greater propulsion - most commonly seen in cricket...
